title: Find Queries
subject: MongoDB
theory: The find() method selects documents in a collection and returns a cursor to the selected documents. You can pass a query filter document to specify which documents to return.

examples.output: Returns cursor to all docs where age is 18

common_mistakes.correction: It returns a Cursor. In the shell, it iterates 20 items. Use .toArray() to get an array (careful with memory).
common_mistakes.example: let user = db.users.find(); user.name // Error (cursor is not the doc)

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between find() and findOne()?
interview_questions.answer: find() returns a cursor (many results). findOne() returns the actual document object (first match).

summary: Querying is how you retrieve value from your stored data.
